alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Nye County; Northwestern Nye County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 11 at 2:11PM PST until December 15 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snowfall with blowing and drifting. Snow amounts of up to two feet in the mountains with up to six inches possible in the valleys above 6000 feet. * WHERE...Central Nevada, particularly elevations above 6000 feet * WHEN...Tuesday through Tuesday night * IMPACTS...Travel impacts are likely along Highway 50 and 6, with whiteout conditions possible at times, particular along the summits. Roads likely become snow covered or impassable at times. Conditions improve from west to east Tuesday night.
info.instruction: A winter storm watch means there is a potential for significant snow, sleet, or ice accumulations that may impact travel. continue to monitor the latest forecasts.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Nye County; Northwestern Nye County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; White Pine County
